metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4422 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The pam_sm_authenticate function in pam_sshauth.c in libpam-sshauth might allow context-dependent attackers to bypass authentication or gain privileges via a system user account.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-sshauth - 0.3.1-1deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> simplified fix in oss-security posting

criterions.comment: libpam-sshauth package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.1-1deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
